slides.body_text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Has my arm lost its power? Now you will see whether or not my word comes true!”

slides.body_text: I am the God of your father—the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.” When Moses heard this, he covered his face because he was afraid to look at God.
slides.name: Exodus 3 6 NLT

slides.body_text: Then the Lord told him, “I have certainly seen the oppression of my people in Egypt. I have heard their cries of distress because of their harsh slave drivers. Yes, I am aware of their suffering.

slides.body_text: And if God cares so wonderfully for wildflowers that are here today and thrown into the fire tomorrow, he will certainly care for you. Why do you have so little faith?

slides.body_text: A voice of one calling: “In the wilderness prepare the way for the Lord; make straight in the desert a highway for our God.

slides.body_text: “Don’t lay a hand on the boy!” the angel said. “Do not hurt him in any way, for now I know that you truly fear God. You have not withheld from me even your son, your only son.”
slides.name: Genesis 22 12 NLT

slides.body_text: Then Abraham looked up and saw a ram caught by its horns in a thicket. So he took the ram and sacrificed it as a burnt offering in place of his son.
slides.name: Genesis 22 13 NLT

slides.body_text: Abraham named the place Yahweh-Yireh (which means “the Lord will provide”). To this day, people still use that name as a proverb: “On the mountain of the Lord it will be provided.”
